article.headline: Oral Roberts 93, UMKC 62
article.story: KANSAS CITY, MO. -- Robert Jarvis had 22 points in leading Oral Roberts to an 93-62 Summit League victory over Missouri-Kansas City Saturday at Municipal Auditorium. It was the fourth consecutive victory for the Golden Eagles (15-13, 13-3) while the Kangaroos (7-22, 3-13) fell for the ninth time in the last 10 games. Oral Roberts led most of the game, leading 48-28 at halftime. The biggest advantage was 38 points at 91-53 with 3:46 left in the game. Jarvis was eight-of-12 from the field and six-of-eight from behind the three-point line. The Golden Eagles had three other players in double figures with Kevin Ford and Kyron Stokes at 16 and Dominique Morrison added 12. Dane Brumagin led UMKC with 16 points. Latreze Mushatt had 15 and Bakari Lewis had 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
